intents.responses: A partly submerged glacier cave on Perito Moreno Glacier .
The ice facade is approximately 60 m high
Ice formations in the Titlis glacier cave
A glacier cave is a cave formed within the ice of a glacier .
Glacier caves are often called ice caves , but this term is properly used to describe bedrock caves that contain year-round ice.

intents.patterns: How are the directions of the velocity and force vectors related in a circular motion
intents.responses: In physics , circular motion is a movement of an object along the circumference of a circle or rotation along a circular path.

intents.patterns: How are the directions of the velocity and force vectors related in a circular motion
intents.responses: It can be uniform, with constant angular rate of rotation (and constant speed), or non-uniform with a changing rate of rotation.

intents.patterns: How are the directions of the velocity and force vectors related in a circular motion
intents.responses: The rotation around a fixed axis of a three-dimensional body involves circular motion of its parts.

intents.patterns: How are the directions of the velocity and force vectors related in a circular motion
intents.responses: The equations of motion describe the movement of the center of mass of a body.

intents.patterns: How are the directions of the velocity and force vectors related in a circular motion
intents.responses: Examples of circular motion include: an artificial satellite orbiting the Earth at constant height, a stone which is tied to a rope and is being swung in circles, a car turning through a curve in a race track , an electron moving perpendicular to a uniform magnetic field , and a gear turning inside a mechanism.

intents.patterns: How are the directions of the velocity and force vectors related in a circular motion
intents.responses: Since the object's velocity vector is constantly changing direction, the moving object is undergoing acceleration by a centripetal force in the direction of the center of rotation.

intents.patterns: How are the directions of the velocity and force vectors related in a circular motion
intents.responses: Without this acceleration, the object would move in a straight line, according to Newton's laws of motion .
Apollo Creed is a fictional character from the Rocky films , initially portrayed as the Undisputed Heavyweight Champion of the World.
